result.execSummary:
The defendant Deangeles J Denton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Provide a DNA sample. Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA, all applicable fees of supervision by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Cash bail applied.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain full time employment/education/vocation.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

timeConds.notes: With Huber. Court STAYED commencement until 10-30-15 by 5pm

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deangeles J Denton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
signed and filed.
The defendant's motion or request for release privileges/additional release privileges is Denied.
The Court intended the defendant to serve the sentence without release privileges.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Timothy M. Witkowiak, Br. 22, for review.  spc
Defendant's pro se request for child care release.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 6 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 2 YEARS probation.

  Conditions of Probation:
- 60 days condition time with Huber. Court stayed commencement until 10/30/2015 by 5pm.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied.

Filed:  
Sentencing Referral Form

Defendant Deangeles J Denton in court with attorney Jerome J. Shimek.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Defendant Deangeles J Denton in court with attorney Jerome J. Shimek.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea and sentencing, however defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Deangeles J Denton in court with attorney Jerome J. Shimek.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea hearing, however defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Deangeles J Denton in court with attorney Jerome J. Shimek.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for DPA hearing, however defendant has new charges.  Court reminds the defendant that he was ordered not to possess dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defense requests plea hearing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Deangeles J Denton in court with attorney Jerome J. Shimek.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. For reasons stated on the record, defense requests an adjournment. Parties advised effective August 1, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22, Room 608 of the Courthouse.   DPA Hearing adjourned to branch 22.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Deangeles J Denton in court with attorney Jerome J. Shimek. Nick Cerwin for David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for Deferred Prosecution on 7/17/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Deangeles J Denton in court with attorney Jerome J. Shimek.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defense received an offer on todays date. Case calendared for STATUS on 6/22/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Deangeles J Denton in court with attorney Jerome J. Shimek.  Zachary Wittchow for David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia or no dangerous weapons or firearms.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Deangeles J Denton in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     
Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
